text:
This D2C skincare brand quietly built an â‚¹83Cr business, 
with 50% of its sales coming from its own website

From a founder with zero beauty background to one building Indiaâ€™s fastest-growing skincare brand.

This is the @FoxtaleSkin story. And itâ€™s just getting startedðŸ§¡
In 2021, @RomitaMazumdar wasnâ€™t trying to chase trends.

She was solving a problem she faced herself
Skincare that worked in labs, actually works for Indian skin.

Recently, Foxtale did something that made me pause, not as a founder, but as a marketer.

They ran a comic-strip ad in the Bombay Times.

No celeb face. No airbrushed skin. No "limited-time offer."

Just clever copy, witty visuals, and a sun in sunglasses heli-dropping SPF.

>Real growth

-FY22 Revenue: â‚¹20 lakh
-FY24 Revenue: â‚¹83 crore
-6x growth in just 2 years
-Customers: 15+ lakh served
-Repeat purchase rate: 50%+
-Retail presence: 1,000+ offline stores
-Online: 50% sales via D2C website, 40% via marketplaces
-$30M Series C raised (led by KOSÃ‰, Japan)

>Recognition & Trust
-Named D2C Brand of the Year by Economic Times
-Featured in Inc42's FAST42 list

What makes Foxtale different?

-Science-backed, dermatologist-tested
-Clear communication, no jargon, no BS
-Brand built with the customer, not just for them

And through it all, Romita Mazumdar stayed grounded.

No celebrity endorsements. No tricks. Just relentless customer focus.

>Foxtale is aiming to become a â‚¹1,000 crore brand with 20% EBITDA in the next 5 years.

This story is worth followingâ€¦
To the Foxtale team: keep building, keep breaking formats, and keep speaking to your audience like you know them. 

Lesson learnt: Focus obsessively on making products people come back for, Retention is the real virality.
